meanings.definition: A small, sweet food item typically eaten as a snack.
meanings.sent1: I love to munch on sunkets like cookies and candies.
meanings.sent2: She packed some sunkets in her lunchbox for school.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they shared the tiny sunkets during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The jar of sunkets on the counter tempted me all day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful sunkets in the bowl looked like a treasure trove.

meanings.definition: To consume food or drink quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the kids sunkets their snacks in no time.
meanings.sent2: He always sunkets his breakfast before rushing off to work.
meanings.sent3: The puppy sunkets his food as if he hasn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent4: She sunkets the hot soup, not caring about the heat.
meanings.sent5: The hungry squirrel sunkets the nuts from the feeder every morning.

meanings.definition: To experience a feeling of pleasure or satisfaction.
meanings.sent1: I sunkets the warmth of the sun on my face during the picnic.
meanings.sent2: She sunkets the joy of reading a good book on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The cat sunkets the comfort of a cozy bed by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: He sunkets the thrill of riding his bike down the hill.
meanings.sent5: The children sunkets the excitement of opening their presents on Christmas morning.
